campaign.story:
Faster-than-light travel has finally allowed humanity to spread beyond its lonely corner of the Milky Way. In the depths of space these explorers found millions of star systems, strange planets, and exotic alien races. Centuries later, they form the Known Worlds, a vital region of trade and technology where empires grow and business thrives.
It is an unparalleled age. Cutting edge science has opened limitless frontiers of space and consciousness, and has even begun to hint at the mysteries of the universe itself. But to find them, one must travel beyond the familiar, to the last parsecs of reality. 
The Last Parsec is a science fiction roleplaying game of exploration and adventure. It requires the Savage Worlds core rules and the Savage Worlds Science Fiction Companion to play.
Characters cross the cosmos under the auspices of JumpCorp, an intergalactic megacorp that contracts exploration, security, bounty hunting, transportation, and everything in between. Adventures take explorers from system to system and planet to planet, finding strange new civilizations, discovering terrifying creatures, and battling pirates, hostile aliens, rival corporations, and stranger things!
Your hero might be a cynical human, a gregarious yeti, a hot-tempered rakashan, or one of 11 total core races--or you can create your own using the Science Fiction Companion.
Rewards
A graphic of all the reward levels listed at right can be found at the bottom of this page, but here's what people usually ask us about first--the level that includes "one of everything." That would be the Jump Chief, and it's everything at a discount over adding everything on to a base level separately.
NOTE: The Jump Captain and Jump Chief backer levels include a set of die-cut Savage Worlds Status Counters on thick cardboard (also available as an Add On). We accidentally left these out of the Pledge levels and can't edit the Reward text to reflect this change, so we're doing it here and on the graphic below. Sorry for the inconvenience!
Wendigo Tales
If you'd like to jump into the setting at hyperspeed, check out our short fiction line, Wendigo Tales: Season Three features The Last Parsec, and the first two tales are already out (with four more coming soon).
The Searchers, by Shane Hensley, and Scrapped, by Cameron Dayton. Available now!
Books
We're taking a "starbox" approach to the overall setting this time. Races, technology, ships, creatures, and more are all covered in the required Science Fiction Companion, so instead of creating a core book first, we're going to do something a little different.
The Last Parsec blasts off with three setting books and several adventures featuring exciting planets, systems, and fantastic events at the edge of the Known Worlds. We'll produce a second wave of books and other material along with an expanded setting book tying more of the background and events together sometime in 2015.
Get the FREE Last Parsec Primer here!
In the meantime, you can get the essential setting information in The Last Parsec Primer, completely free and available now!
Here are the first three settings for The Last Parsec, written and illustrated by Pinnacle's best. We're only going to sell the books in sets during the Kickstarter--which also gets you the unlocked digital rewards. After the Kickstarter, each book will be available separately as usual.
Each book contains detailed background on a system, planet, or other location, any new Edges, Hindrances, Gear, Ships, or Setting Rules important to the area, a Plot Point Campaign, Savage Tales, and a Bestiary covering the strange xenos and shady characters one might meet in the distant reaches.
Each book is full-color, 96 pages, in our standard graphic novel format so everything lines up nice and neat on your shelf. All three settings are available in softback and Limited Edition hardback.
Eris Beta-V: A JumpCorp-employed team of explorers investigates a magnificent ringed gas giant with its numerous moons. Ancient artifacts of enormous power can be found among the rings and asteroids. Every moon is a unique world to be explored. When the system’s valuable commerce is threatened by unscrupulous agencies, the team must root them out and put themselves at great risk on the icy fringes of interstellar space. Written by Matt Cutter (Deadlands Brand Manager).
Scientorium: Hidden away by sheer distance and forever shrouded from the minds of the curious lies a mammoth artifact from the previous galactic age, the library of Scientorium. Its strange experience chambers offer passage to a million histories on a million worlds, secrets and technologies undreamed of. Now abandoned by all but its automated security systems and enigmatic caretakers, its workings are oddly twisted and jealous, meting out reward and punishment in equal measure. This is a classic science fiction saga, an epic journey across space and time in the vein of Niven or Heinlein! Written by Timothy Brian Brown (Dragon Kings, Dark Sun, Traveller).
Leviathan: Hunt the most dangerous game in the Known Worlds! The jungle planet Leviathan teems with mammoth lacerauns, savage beasts of enormous size and cunning, potential trophies unmatched in any other star system. Intentionally undeveloped beyond a few tourist-oriented settlements, Leviathan nonetheless draws more than just adventure-seeking hunters though, including researchers and those who would see the world left completely untouched. Both are more than willing to turn the tables on any would-be hunters. Written by John Goff (Night Train, Deadlands Noir).
Poster Maps
Just like the poster maps we did for Deadlands Noir, Weird Wars Rome, and East Texas University, we're creating two double-sided, dry-erase maps on heavy paper stock. This time out the maps feature four different ships (dropship, freighter, pirate vessel, and research ship) you can use for your JumpCorp team or the treacherous foes who cross their path.
Here's a peek at the map work in progress--we'll update this with more detailed pics as they near completion.
Game Master's Screen
The Last Parsec GM's screen is a tri-fold, landscape screen featuring gorgeous full-color artwork on one side and all the important charts and tables for the game on the other.
The GM's screen also includes The Last Parsec Primer in printed form and an original adventure (that sets up one of our future settings) by Ross Watson called The Enigma Equation.
Miniatures
Our friends at Bronze Age Miniatures have created nine exclusive miniatures representing some of the most popular archetypes from the Savage Worlds Science Fiction Companion and The Last Parsec.
The set contains the aurax, construct, deader, male and female human, insectoid, kalian, Serran, and yeti.
Best of all, if you pledge for the minis during the Kickstarter and the bonus figures listed under Stretch Goals are unlocked (the Floran, Saurian, and Rakashan), we'll include them in your set free!
Figures sculpted by Bronze Age Miniatures.
Add-Ons
Everyone who pledges for physical shipments can add additional items to their shipment at no additional shipping cost. (After the KS you can always order these from our store at standard shipping rates.)
Simply increase your pledge by the amount shown. When we send out the Final Survey, your credit will apply.
Stretch Goals
Here are the additional digital or physical unlocks we plan on releasing if we exceed our original funding goal:
Rogue Traders (Merchant Level)
Kickstarter's Reward boxes don't allow formatting, so we decided to put the list of items and terms here where it's easier to understand:
This Reward level is for "Brick and Mortar" stores only and can be purchased as many times as you like. It includes:
3 x Leviathan in Limited Edition Hardback ($75 retail value)
3 x Scientorium in Limited Edition Hardback ($75 retail value)
3 x Eris Beta-V in Limited Edition Hardback ($75 retail value)
3 x GM's Screen + Adventure ($60 retail value)
2 x Dropship and Freighter dry-erase, poster-size ship maps ($30 retail value)
2 x Pirate and Research Vessel dry-erase poster-size ship maps ($30 retail value)
2 x Double Action Deck ($60 retail value)
All this will be shipped freight free to the continental US *BEFORE* general release.
Please note that if we cannot verify your brick and mortar store, you will receive the Jump Captain package and a prorated refund instead.
The Kickstarter
The books and adventures are already in layout, the first wave of miniatures are done, and we're ready to go. We're using Kickstarter so that we can make some of the extras listed in the Stretch Goals above.
Our last Kickstarter for East Texas University is at the printer and the last of the digital rewards are coming out fast and furious by the 12 to Midnight Crew.
Reward Summary

campaign.story:
5th Edition Rules: 1st Edition Feel! Necromancer Games re-animates itself bigger, better, and badder than ever before for the 5th Edition of the *world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying game. With the help of Steve Winter and Ed Greenwood, we are going to be creating supplemental books (up to 3 of them!) to play the new edition Old School Style — the Necromancer way.
5th Edition Foes - between 200-250 additional creatures, beasts, monsters and titans to challenge your players and enhance your adventures!
Quests of Doom: X Adventures Worth Winning -12+ adventures worth winning, each written by one of our many iconic authors. (X begins with 12 and increases based on stretch goals.)
Book of Lost Spells - Hundreds of new spells to enhance your 5th edition spell casters and NPCs.
Just like we did with the Third Edition, our objective isn’t to compete with the the upcoming 5th edition; it’s to offer resources for playing the game the old way, old school style. In general it’s darker and deadlier gaming than the official recommendations. It’s not for crybabies. Between 1999 and 2006, we racked up award after award, picking up worldwide recognition as a publishing powerhouse... and now we’re back!
Authors
"To pull this project together and give it the right “feel” for Necromancer Games, we recruited an amazing lineup of writers. Start with a core of Necromancer Games regulars like Bill Webb (Rappan Athuk, The Lost City of Barakus), Matt Finch (Swords & Wizardry, Tome of Adventure Design), J. Collura (Caverns of Thracia Reloaded, Chaos Rising), Michael Curtis (The Dungeon Alphabet, Realms of Crawling Chaos), and Casey Christofferson (The Tome of Horrors, City of Brass). Throw in a few D&D long-timers like Steve Winter (Tyranny of Dragons, Murder in Baldur’s Gate), James M. Ward (Gamma World, Pool of Radiance, Castle Keeper’s Guide), Skip Williams (Axe of the Dwarvish Lords, The Rod of Seven Parts), and Ed Greenwood (The Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting, The City of Splendors). The result is a stack of adventures that are guaranteed to break bones, stir long-forgotten nightmares, push heroes to their utmost limits, and cement massive grins on the faces of players and DMs alike."
Here's the Problem
5th Edition is brand new and we have absolutely no idea how many books to print, so Kickstarter is going to be a very important tool. We're going to let you, our valued customers, tell us how many books to print.
What You Get
Eventually, there will be three books, all library-bound hardcovers made for decades of use, written by the Necromancer Games team of Steve Winter, Bill Webb, Greg Vaughan, Matt Finch, J. Collura, Michael Curtis, Casey Christofferson, James M. Ward, Skip Williams, and Ed Greenwood. 
(Covers shown are mockups; the final covers may differ slightly)
We start out with monsters: a book called 5th Edition Foes. It’s going to start with 200 monsters in it, which means it will be about 220 pages. That’s an estimate. As we hit stretch goals, we’ll add more monsters as we continue to raise money.
(Covers shown are mockups; the final covers may differ slightly)
The next book is Quests of Doom, an adventure book we estimate at 180-260 pages, depending on stretch goals achieved. It will contain two updates from third edition books (Demons and Devils, Vampires and Liches) that contained a total of six adventures. PLUS, it will contain 6-12 new adventures under the section titles "Bugs and Blobs", “Giants and Dragons,” “Men and Monstrosities,” and “Elementals and Lycanthropes.” This is where we bring in some heavy hitters as authors, but we haven’t nailed down which author is going to write which adventure. That information might get settled during the duration of the Kickstarter, but we’re not rushing it. The author lineup might not be finalized until after the Kickstarter is finished — see below about how this Kickstarter is a little different from our prior ones. For those following the Lost Lands™ Campaign Setting, Greg Vaughan will be making sure that the adventures are all fully compatible with and integrated into the Lost Lands. This book will be $40, that's $3.33 per adventure! If we make all of our stretch goals the price drops to $2.22 per adventure! 
(Covers shown are mockups; the final covers may differ slightly)
The third book that comes available as a stretch goal is the 5th Edition Book of Lost Spells. This sourcebook will contain hundreds of spells, and we estimate that it will run 250 pages. The contents will be drawn from several books Necromancer Games wrote for 3rd Edition, but we will also be culling out a lot that doesn't work with 5th Edition, and adding a few new ones.
This One's a Little Different
Our team (through Frog God Games) has run, funded, and fulfilled 3 Kickstarters (Rappan Athuk, Swords & Wizardry, and Razor Coast), and we have 2 more that are in the fulfillment process (Lost City of Barakus and Sword of Air). These 5 Kickstarters raised a total of over $600,000. In each of them, we had most of the work done ahead of time, and the main focus was on raising money for the art, the printing, and so forth. For this one, it’s a little different because we’re operating ahead of the normal timeline. Not all of the game’s rules are known to us at this time, and probably a couple of them are still being finalized in the Crystal Towers of Renton. 
This means we’re creating a product that has some unknown variables, and it means that you’re backing it more as a patron than as a pre-order customer. We’re going to deliver these books, but it’s going to be an evolving process.
Why So Early?
It might seem like we’re jumping the gun on this project: after all, why not just wait until the Core Books are published by the Wizards, and start then? Two answers. First of all, to be very selfish about it, if we’re first we can snag all the best artists and authors before someone else does. That gives us a superior product and a reputation for excellence. The second reason is that when a new edition comes out, the game masters want more monsters, adventures, and other resources immediately. Some publisher is going to provide them, and we want it to be us. Our products have a lot of lead time, because our book-bindings are library quality, because we work with A-team authors and artists who have waiting lists, and because good editing and good art take time. If we’re going to put top-of-the-line products out there when our customers want them, we have to start now. 
Add-Ons
Some add-ons may be added as stretch goals. Hang tight, keep watching, and don’t split the party. 
$50 Signed Adventure Book - If you'd like your copy Quests of Doom signed by all the authors simply add $50 to your pledge.
$200 Leather Bound Cover (per book) - We do real leather covers, not composite leather (ground-up scraps pressed into shape). We buy leather by the hide, and that’s what goes on our leather-bound books. Our leather covers are the real deal. BONUS: All Leather Books are Signed by the Authors!
Stretch Goals*

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In this Kickstarter, you’re almost certain to get something that’s slightly different from the way we are planning it right at this moment, because we’re raising money and starting work before the whole game is even out on the shelves. Page counts will vary depending on the length and format of the material, licensing requirements might alter the content of updated material, and so on. 

HOWEVER, from experience in the many Kickstarters that we have fulfilled or are currently fulfilling, we believe that we have eliminated or accounted for the main risks that cause less-experienced companies to fail. We have (a) already priced the products to account for potential increases in the cost of shipping and postage over the course of production, (b) have a sophisticated in-house pledge management software system that has already been used successfully to fulfill large Kickstarters, (c) have backup authors and editors lined up, (d) already have the majority of the art, (e) already have the majority of the non-rules-specific text written, (f) have our own climate-controlled warehouse space, (g) have a long-standing relationship with two printers based on being a customer that places five-digit orders several times a year and (h) have considerable capital available to use in case there are unexpected expenses or cash-flow glitches. 

A number of other factors in this particular Kickstarter may be affected by third parties, including the Wizards of the Coast delivery schedule for books and pdfs, and also our freelance artists, writers, and editors. Several details of rules-presentation may affect page count (the number of lines in a monster stat block, for example). Lastly, a risk we must address is the health of each one of our authors and their ability to write adventures in each one of these books. We do not expect any complications, but if any do arise, we will do everything in our power to write and deliver the books on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What people are saying about The Lost Dungeons of Xon:
"I saw their product demo in person at Origins and I was blown away. Very professional, well put together, extremely functional." - Bryan Stiltz, Production Manager, Reaper Miniatures
"Good stuff! Seems like you're getting a lot for your money here...worth checking out!" - Stefan Pokorny, CEO and Founder, Dwarven Forge
Click the banner to download a free preview of our first module!
What is Burning Yeti Studios?
Burning Yeti Studios is a group of highly experienced gamers and creative professionals with a proven record in the gaming and publishing industries. Our team of industry professionals includes a three-time successful Kickstarter, a former game store owner, and two former editors from the monthly magazine InQuest Gamer.
What is The Lost Dungeons of Xon?
The Lost Dungeons of Xon is an original series of Pathfinder™ compatible roleplaying modules designed to be used with any campaign world. The Adventurer pledge will include three distinct adventures collectively designed to take a party of adventurers from 1st to 6th level.
What format will the modules be available in?The modules and supplemental material will be released in electronic format only, as interactive PDFs.
What is an “Interactive PDF”?
Most roleplaying supplements available in PDF format are simply an electronic version of the book. The Lost Dungeons of Xon takes this format to the next level by including several features that simply aren’t possible in print form:
Narrated Room Descriptions - Professionally-recorded audio narration introductions for each encounter area 
Pop-up stat blocks for NPCs and Monsters so GMs don’t need to flip through pages to find them
Direct navigation to room and encounter descriptions from an interactive overview map 
PRD Hyperlinks to full spell and creature descriptions on Paizo's Pathfinder™ online reference document
Unlockable content - Password-secured player materials such as maps and clues that can be unlocked by a GM-provided password at the appropriate time during an adventure
What else makes this different from other roleplaying modules?
The Lost Dungeons of Xon is the first series of roleplaying modules designed specifically to make use of the rewards from two of the gaming industry's most successful Kickstarter campaigns: Dwarven Forge’s Game Tiles™ and Reaper’s Bones™ miniatures.
All of the dungeons the players will explore in The Lost Dungeons of Xon can be assembled using just two sets of Game Tiles™, and all the miniatures we feature come from the Vampire-pledge level of the first Bones™ Kickstarter. If you backed either or both of these campaigns, you’ll find specific guidelines for which pieces to use in conjunction with the modules.
The Lost Dungeons of Xon are "pre-build friendly". We’ve come up with a unique and compelling backstory that allows you to set up the physical dungeons in advance. Because of the way the stories are designed, the layout of each dungeon is in-character knowledge the players will have right from the start of the scenario. Therefore, you won’t be giving anything away by having the entire dungeon laid out on the table.
What if I didn’t back one of or both of those projects?
While our scenarios are enhanced by the use of Game Tiles™ and Bones™ miniatures, they aren’t required; you can run the modules as you would any other pen & paper RPG. We’ve put a lot of effort into coming up with an interesting story with enjoyable puzzles and challenges for the players, so even if you don’t own the accessories you should consider backing our project. With all the interactive features we have, there simply isn't anything else like it.
UPDATE: The good folks at Reaper have put together a special package which includes all the BONES miniatures featured in "The Lost Dungeons of Gold and Blood". There's a special 10% discount, and you can see the details here.
Also, for potential backers who do NOT own Dwarven Forge's Game Tiles... When the modules are released we will have printable copies of the dungeon maps available on our website, which can be used as a substitute for the Game Tiles.
What kind of art will the modules have?
While content is king when it comes to roleplaying supplements, we also recognize the importance of looking good. The art direction is another aspect of our project that is unique. The visuals in our modules feature not only pre-configured Game Tile™ layouts, but high-resolution photographs of professionally-painted miniatures as well.
How long are the modules?
The first module in the series, "The Lost Dungeon of Gold and Blood" is a 25-page PDF. The second and third modules - "The Stronghold of the Banshee Cabal" and "The Endless Dark" will be approximately 50 pages each. All three modules will have companion Digital Player's Guides that will be 5-8 pages long.
Reward Comparison Chart
Release Dates
"The Lost Dungeon of Gold and Blood" will be available to ALL backers (at the Explorer level or higher) by September 2014.
Our Inner Circle members will receive early draft versions of the second and third modules by December 2014.
The final versions of the second and third modules, along with any stretch goals and unlocked add-ons, are expected to be available by March 2015.
Stretch Goals
$16,500 Stretch Goal [Locked]: Character Pack #0
This bonus content, free to all backers at the Scout/Adventurer level or higher, will include full-page character sheets and detailed backgrounds for the arrogant and over-bearing Dirk Dunland and the other members of his party. These complete and in-depth character folios will give you everything you need to fully flesh out these NPC's, and even to use them as player characters in another campaign if you choose.
Other Stretch Goals
We have a lot more great stretch goals planned. Some will be free to anyone who backs at the Scout / Adventurer level or higher, others will be paid add-ons available to all backers. (Note that if you back at the Master or Inner Circle level, you get ALL add-ons for free.)
Paid add-ons will generally be $5 or $10. Some of the goodies we've got planned include:
Character packs with full-page backgrounds and folios for the main NPCs in the modules
Bonus dungeon encounters that aren't part of the main story and can be inserted into any campaign
A story-based choose-your-own-adventure online character generator
An epic Dragon Battle encounter designed and balanced for high-level characters
All of the stretch goals and add-ons will include the same high-quality of photography and painted miniatures featured in our main modules.
No Surprises Section
While we will endeavor to ensure that all the features of our interactive PDFs work on as many platforms as possible, it’s still a relatively recent technology. We do extensive testing, but we can’t always account for certain versions of software and operating systems. To fully utilize the features of the PDFs, you may have to download a new version of Adobe Reader to your laptop, desktop or tablet, or install the latest system updates for your device.
Due to the interactive nature of the PDF, the GM should plan to have a computer or tablet on hand to run the module. If the players have technology as well, their experience can be enhanced by using the Digital Player's Guides, but they are not required. All the information in the player's guides will also be available as printable content.
While we are constraining ourselves to the Game Tiles found in the original two-set Kickstarter campaign for the basic dungeon layouts, supplementary and bonus material can and will utilize pieces that were not available from the base Kickstarter. For example, our tavern brawl - an optional encounter in the first module - uses pieces from the “Dungeon Dressing” add-on pack.
Finally, while the first module is complete, the second and third modules are currently in development and the titles are subject to change.
About Burning Yeti Studios
Burning Yeti Studios is a team of highly experienced gamers and creative professionals with a proven record in the industry. 
Jeff Hannes previously worked as Senior Editor for InQuest Gamer magazine and has written material for Iron Crown Enterprises and Last Unicorn Games. 
Michael Searle is Burning Yeti's graphic designer. He was Executive Editor of InQuest Gamer and has written over 50 published strategy guides for video games.
Dave Breen is the owner of GameKnight Products, Inc. and has launched three successful Kickstarter campaigns selling custom poker chips designed specifically for gamers. 
Joel Lytle is a former owner of the All About Games! retail store (and the reigning Through the Ages board game world champion to boot). 
From their years at InQuest—a monthly gaming magazine that was in game shops and on newsstands for over twelve years, Jeff and Mike have experience meeting deadlines and putting out creative content. From his GameKnight projects, Dave knows exactly what it takes to run a Kickstarter from start to finish.
Jeff (GM) running a Lost Dungeons play-test with Mike (orange shirt), Joel (blue shirt, red jacket) and friends. Dave, as is often the case, is behind the camera.

As with any creative endeavor, the biggest challenge will be delivering the items on time. Fortunately, we’ve already put a great deal of effort into The Lost Dungeons of Xon series. The first module is complete, and we plan to release shortly after the end of the campaign.

The remaining materials (including bonus materials and add-ons) will need to be completed, designed and, most importantly, play-tested. While we’ve allotted an appropriate amount of time for play-testing in our production schedule, there is always the possibility that player feedback could necessitate significant changes to the story. In the unlikely event that happens, a delay might be unavoidable.

campaign.story:
Originally released using a modified version of the Fate system contained in Strands of Fate and Fate Core, Nova Praxis is going to be re-released for the Savage Worlds game system.
Nova Praxis originally Kickstarted for almost $30,000. It quickly went Platinum on DrivethruRPG, and was released in hardcover through voidstarstudios.com and IndiePressRevolution.
This new core book will contain the setting information contained in the original Nova Praxis core book, expanded with new material from Machinations: the Nova Praxis GM's Guide. The Savage Worlds rules are being written by Shaintar creator and industry veteran, Sean Patrick Fannon!
The Book and PDF
Nova Praxis: Savage Worlds Edition will be released in the same digest format as the Savage Worlds Explorer's Edition. We estimate it to be roughly 250 pages, standard print. We are shooting for an August release in hopes of getting it out to everyone by GenCon.
In addition to this book, you will need the Savage Worlds core rules to play Nova Praxis. The Savage Worlds Science Fiction Companion is a useful add-on, but is not necessary.
The PDF will be a bookmarked version of the print edition. But if we hit the stretch goal (see below), we will also produce an Augmented PDF, featuring a tablet friendly layout and a number of enhancements for improved navigation. You can learn more about the A-PDF for the Fate version here. And we're striving to make sure the one for Savage Worlds is even better.
Playtesting
The playtest is live! One of the updated visible to backers includes a link to the playtest doc.
Reviews
Nova Praxis was originally released for the Fate system. The Savage Worlds Edition will have different game mechanics of course, but here's what people have said about the original version...
“Nova Praxis has a stunningly realized and fleshed out setting. I mean this in a very good way. The worlds of the solar system, factions and organizations within the world are all well thought out and realized within the game. I think that this is a key to a game that wants to be transhumanist: you have to understand and work out the social structures of the setting. Transhumanism is an evolutionist philosophy (from my viewpoint) that tries to work out how great changes in technology and science will impact not only those sciences but society and people as well. In Nova Praxis, the Void Star Games people have certainly gotten that part right. Thought has gone into the world of their future, and how the advances have impacted it and the people who live there.“ – Christopher Helton, Dorkland
“Man, it was exactly what I was looking for!… Needless to say, if you play any kind of Fate, and want sci-fi, transhuman, or cyberpunk elements in your game, then you couldn't go wrong with Nova Praxis.” - Paul M. [5 of 5 Stars]
[Referring to the Augmented PDF] “Quite possibly the most useful and beautiful PDF ever created for gaming…” – Seth B. [5 of 5 Stars]
“I don't do a lot of reviews, but I feel compelled to do so in this case. The game I'm reviewing, Nova Praxis, a FATE-based ruleset, is just that good. And the delivery system, an enhanced PDF, is really amazing in terms of its clean aesthetic and overall usability. Color me very, very impressed.” – Edgar Johnson
“It is a very engaging game with an excellent developed setting that tackles many fundamental issues and themes inherent to the genre itself. Action, conspiracies, ethical and moral issues, social dichotomies, and much more! Basically, this roleplaying game offers us a fantastic playground to develop and create any types of memorable stories.“ – Yohann Delalande
IMPORTANT! - PLEASE READ!
If you back a tier that offers a print copy of the book, when it becomes available, you will be sent a coupon code to get the book at cost from DrivethruRPG. What does "at cost" mean? It means the coupon code will cover the cost of the book, but not printing or shipping. Void Star Studios makes no profit at this stage. This is the cost of printing and delivery paid to DrivethruRPG to get the printed book into your hands.
The book will be available in softcover and hardcover, in standard and premium color. DrivethruRPG estimates the print costs as follows:
Softcover Premium Color - $13.30 to $16.50
Softcover Standard Color - $7.50 to $8.80
Hardcover Premium Color - $18.80 to $22.10
Hardcover Standard Color - $12.60 to $14.50
Make sure you factor this in when selecting your backer tier. This is the amount you will have to pay in addition to your backer tier and shipping costs.
Shipping costs vary by location. DrivethruRPG ships internationally, and estimated shipping costs can be found here.
To clarify... After the Kickstarter has ended and the book has been released, you will be issued a coupon code that discounts the price of the print version such that you only pay for the print and shipping costs. How much you must pay at that time depends on the type of print job you select (as shown above) and your location.
Evolved Backers: As a thank you, your name will be listed in a special "Thank You" section of the book. Also, you will get PDF copies of all the books unlocked through the stretch goals listed below as they are released. And if we raise enough to produce an Augmented PDF ($9,000), Evolved backers will get both the regular PDF and the Augmented PDF at no extra cost.
$8,000 - The Augmented PDF [DONE!] - We will develop an Augmented version of the PDF. Evolved backers will get both the regular PDF, and the Augmented PDF, at no additional cost.
$8,500 - Game Master's Screen - We will develop a Nova Praxis: Savage Worlds Edition Game Master's Screen PDF. Evolved backers will get this PDF for free.
$9,500 - Ghosts in Darkness - We will develop and release the introductory scenario, Ghosts in Darkness for Nova Praxis: Savage Worlds Edition. Evolved backers will get this PDF for free when it is released.
$10,000 - Work Hazards - We will begin developing Work Hazards, a book of alien creatures, biotechnological horrors, combat drones, terrorists, pirates and other NPCs to challenge your players with. Evolved backers will get this PDF for free when it is released. Work Hazards will be released featuring both Savage Worlds and Fate stats.
$11,000 - Nova Praxis Cards - We will develop a custom set of Nova Praxis playing cards for use in determining initiative. These cards will be available through DrivethruCards around the same time the book releases. Evolved backers will get a PDF of these cards for free.
$12,000 - Fragmentation - Mike McConnell will begin writing Fragmentation, a Nova Praxis novel. Evolved backers will get this ebook/PDF for free when it is released.
$13,000 - Galactic Gazetteer: The Sol System - We will begin development on the Galactic Gazetteer: The Sol System. This book, for both the Fate and Savage Worlds version of Nova Praxis, will feature an in-depth look at the planets in the Sol system, with particular emphasis on Earth. Evolved backers will get this PDF for free when it is released.
$16,000 - The Vantage Strain - We will begin developing The Vantage Strain a massive pre-written scenario for both Savage Worlds and Fate versions of Nova Praxis. Evolved backers will get this PDF for free when it is released.
$18,000 - Designer Raise! - Contributing writers get a 10% pay raise! RPG writers are woefully under paid, and this lets us better support those who worked hard to bring you this book.
$20,000 - Digital Initiative - If we come this far, we're going to dive into a new digital initiative. We'll start with character creation apps for the web, Android and iOS phones and tablets; and expand from there with additional digital tools for both Savage Worlds and Fate versions of Nova Praxis.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've already ran one successful Kickstarter, and this one is very similar. But even though our first one was a success, we still had a few challenges. This time we have the benefit of experience, and know more about the potential pitfalls we might fall into.

The biggest pitfall last time was in correctly estimating international shipping costs, an issue we will be avoiding entirely this time.

The biggest challenges are getting the product put together. This will be our 4th book of this sort, so we are well aware of what it takes to get the writing, editing, art and layout done. Publishing will be handled through DrivethruRPG, a company we have a great relationship, and much experience, with.

We also have Sean Patrick Fannon onboard this time, and he also has experience with running a successful Kickstarter.

We are keeping it simple and to the point with this campaign, being careful to not over-promise or under-deliver.

campaign.story:
They say ETU is a great place to earn a quality education without the big city distractions and dangers. This is the 21st century and no one wants to admit they’ve helplessly watched a classmate get sucked into the pages of a library book, come face-to-face with an angry ghost, or glimpsed a creature prowling the campus by the light of the full moon.
College is where you make your own choices and find out who you really are. You can keep your head down, hoping to avoid the twisted horrors you sometimes catch out of the corner of your eye, or you can face your fears, fight the darkness, and protect your campus. Everyone starts out as a wide-eyed freshman, but if you survive four years at ETU you’ll be a hero.
The Books
The ETU line debuts with two, 96-page, full-color books in our graphic novel format. We expect to deliver the PDFs in July. Assuming the Kickstarter is successful, the physical products should ship no later than November.
The core book, East Texas University, offers a well-rounded syllabus of character creation, new Edges & Hindrances, gear, Setting Rules, and tours of campus and nearby Pinebox, Texas. For advanced credit, read the section on rituals and talismans. Finally, the Adventure Generator and encyclopedia of miscreants is sure to light a creative spark in even the most humorless campus parking enforcement officer.
Welcome to ETU. Classes start this Fall. Register now.
The second book, Degrees of Horror, includes a full-length Plot Point Campaign designed to take your class from Freshmen to graduation—if they survive! We can't say much about the plot, but suffice to say it's a Big Deal for Pinebox...and maybe beyond. Degrees of Horror also features a full course-load of Savage Tales that work equally well with the Plot Point Campaign or your own epic saga.
A Plot Point Campaign and additional Savage Tales for ETU!
The Game Master's Screen
This tri-fold screen features a scene of chaos on campus on the player's side, and all the important charts and tables for the game on the GM's side. It also includes a full-length 32-page adventure by Ed Wetterman—we'll give you details and show you the cover in one of our first updates.
When students at East Texas University talk about surviving college, they mean it…literally!
All pledge levels include unlocked digital rewards and free domestic shipping!
Add Ons!
We have four Add Ons for everyone who pledges at the Junior level Reward or higher (if you order an Add On and only pledged for PDFs we'll refund your Add On pledge since this doesn't cover the shipping).
These items will be available as Add Ons after the Kickstarter closes, but at a higher retail price. To get the lower prices reflected below, include them in your pledge (you can tell us exactly what the extra funds are for when we mail out the Final Survey).
Note that you must pledge at the Junior level or higher to order any of these items as Add Ons. International customers must add an additional $20 if you add one or more sets of Bennies, miniatures, or Go Ravens! dice. There is no extra cost for shipping the maps.
All the Add Ons for East Texas University, all visual like. :)
Add On Details
Bennies (Pack of 20 high-quality ceramic poker chips): Please add +$15 to your pledge
All TEN ETU 28mm Miniatures: Please add +$50 to your pledge
GO RAVENS! Dice set: Please add + $10 to your pledge
Two double-sided dry-erase poster maps (ETU classrooms, the library, off-campus housing, and Pinebox businesses): Please add $25 (Sorry, we aren't selling the two packs separately during the Kickstarter)
Closer view of the Gals of ETU!
Closer view of the Guys of ETU!
Unlockable Digital Rewards
We're going with the number of *backers* for this Kickstarter rather than funding levels, so *you* can help us get the word out and unlock more and more cool stuff for everyone.
Please note that all unlockable rewards are downloadable PDFs or other digital files.
Here's the schedule of rewards and the number of backers (in parentheses) which unlocks them. Note that our funding must be successful before any rewards are unlocked.
Soundtrack (200 Backers): The ETU original soundtrack, "Trouble in Texas." UNLOCKED
Archetypes (300 Backers): Ten full-color, full-page, ready-to-play archetypes, with Figure Flats. UNLOCKED
Creature Feature — La Bruja (400 Backers ): Art, background, statistics, Figure Flats, and several adventure seeds featuring the terrifying Mexican witches known as la bruja! UNLOCKED
Figure Flats I - Heroes of ETU (500 Backers): Two full pages of "printable miniatures" including students, faculty, and civilians. UNLOCKED
A Body Was Found…: (600 Backers ): A 12-page ETU storytelling adventure using the Protocol system. (Find out more at the Postworld Games site) NEW! We're also adding the classic 12tM adventure, Last Rites, to this stretch goal! UNLOCKED
University Press (700 Backers): Electronic templates to print your own customized handouts including a welcome letter, Dean's List, academic probation, ETU diploma, and blank ETU letterhead. UNLOCKED
Figure Flats II - Horrors of East Texas (800 Backers): All the critters from the book, including chupacabras, ghosts, an assortment of wicked demons, and more.
Return of the Chickens in the Mist—Murder Most Fowl! (900 Backers): Follow-up to the original hit adventure, Chickens in the Mist! (Available now at the Pinnacle store.)
Online Adventure Generator (1,000 Backers): An ETU adventure generator for SWToolset.com, building on—and expanding—the results found in East Texas University.
The 12 to Midnight Legacy Collection (1200 Backers): Digital copies of ALL the previous Pinebox adventures, including: Last Rites, Chickens in the Mist, Bloodlines, Ed's Midnight Tales, Jerry's Midnight Tales, Skinwalker, Brainwashed, The Beast Within, PLUS the short stories in Buried Tales of Pinebox, Texas.
Merchant Reward Level
Kickstarter's Reward boxes don't allow formatting, so we decided to put the list of items and terms here where it's easier to understand:
This Reward level is for "Brick and Mortar" stores only and can be purchased as many times as you like. It includes:
4 x Limited Edition Hardbacks (MSRP $24.99)
3 x Regular Editions (MSRP $19.99)
3 x GM Screen + Adventure (MSRP $19.99)
3 x of each of our two double-sided, dry-erase ETU Maps (MSRP $15 each; 6 packs total featuring the ETU classrooms, the library, off-campus housing, and Pinebox businesses).
All this will be shipped freight free to the continental US *BEFORE* general release.
Please note that if we cannot verify your brick and mortar store, you will receive the Master's Student package and a prorated refund instead.
Add Ons After the Kickstarter
We'll ask for Add Ons before we ship should you wish to add anything, but the prices may be higher, and may require additional shipping charges. We *highly* recommend pledging now if you think you'll want any of the Add Ons (you can always reduce your pledge if you change your mind up until the Kickstarter closes). Thanks!
More on Pinebox and ETU
Want to know more? Visit the original 12 to Midnight site here.

campaign.story:
Summary of this Kickstarter:
Level 5 DCC RPG adventure module to be manufactured with a puzzle on inside front cover that consists of 3 spinning wheels.
Spinning wheel edition to be produced with limited edition silver foil cover, at $30 price. "Regular" color cover edition is also available (featuring the wheel graphic without the moving parts) at a price of $10.
Written by Michael Curtis with inspiration from Appendix N author Manley Wade Wellman. Includes additional mini-adventure "The Rat King's River of Death" by Steven Bean.
You can support this by pledging for the adventure module itself, and also by pledging for other DCC RPG modules, which are on sale for 20% off as part of this Kickstarter.
The project includes many fun stretch goals that, if funded, will make this an even more extravagant module.
Update 6/1: Yet another stretch goal beaten!
First, the Chained Coffin will be a boxed set! All Kickstarter orders of silver foil or gold foil will include the box.
Second, we have now passed stretch goal #11! The gazetteer will now be expanded even more! And there will now be a THIRD adventure included in the boxed set, in addition to the Almanac, the 0-level bonus module, the Chained Coffin, and the add-on spinning wheel!
Third, we have posted an update with a variety of new add-on items! Support the project with a T-shirt, flask, belt buckle, or beer cozy!
Finally, please note that the spinning wheel prop will be printed as a separate cardboard handout for the foil editions.
Dungeon Crawl Classics is the longest-running line of adventure modules currently available for tabletop role playing games, with the 82nd sequential DCC module recently released to game stores worldwide. This Kickstarter funds a special feature in an upcoming DCC module: a player handout that includes 3 spinning wheels on the inside cover of Dungeon Crawl Classics: The Chained Coffin. The 3 spinning wheels form an elaborate puzzle that can be solved by clever (or lucky) players. The wheel puzzle contains a number of strange symbols which can be re-used by the judge in future adventures, and the adventure text includes several alternate uses for future modules. This edition of the module features a unique silver foil cover.
The wheel puzzle: can you solve it? This Kickstarter will allow all three wheels to be printed on card stock and turn independently!
Why Kickstarter? Manufacturing this customized wheel puzzle requires hand-assembly within the printing plant. Publishing books in a standard format is a well-established process that uses standardized machinery, but customized puzzle manufacturing requires time-consuming, expensive hand assembly. This Kickstarter funds the incremental cost of manufacturing the adventure module with a three-dimensional wheel puzzle “that really spins,” packaged on the inside cover of the adventure module. 
Even without the successful funding of this Kickstarter, The Chained Coffin will still be published. Without the Kickstarter, the puzzle will be presented as a “cut out and assemble at home” graphic. If this Kickstarter funds, however, backers will receive a version of the module that contains the moving puzzle with physical wheels that actually spin, with a unique silver foil cover. At further levels, there is an opportunity to add more fun features, as described in the stretch goals below. 
The limited edition silver foil cover
What Lies Within The Chained Coffin?
The adventure is designed for level 5 characters. A whispered voice calls from a coffin bound in chains, urging the heroes into the depths of the Shudder Mountains, a place rife with superstition and forlorn secrets. In the shadowy, pine-grown valleys of the Deep Hollows lurk mysteries of a bygone age and a new evil emerging from the ruins of the past. The adventurers must plumb the mountains’ secluded reaches to root out this rising terror before its power comes to fruition. Standing in their path are cackling witches, subtle devils, lingering spirits, and a foul thing that moves in the night. Can the heroes appease that which lies within the Chained Coffin and thwart the dawn of a new and terrible age?
Shown here is a physical mockup of what we plan to manufacture. As you can see, each wheel spins independently. Can you solve the puzzle?
The Spinning Wheel Puzzle
The adventure includes a number of supernatural locations. The entrance to one is blocked by a supernatural door. It is this door that comprises the spinning wheel puzzle that is the subject of this Kickstarter: 
Beyond the ancient bridge is a 40’ wide, 30’ deep ledge that lies perpendicular to a sheer rock face. Set into the rocky cliff at the far side of the ledge stands a great stone archway sealed by an imposing door. Blue bolts of lightning ripple silently across the door’s face, hinting at magical wards or seals. In the center of the door are three circular dials set one inside the next. Each dial bears several different symbols, no two of which repeat.
Artist Doug Kovacs has rendered this door in a beautiful player handout (see image above). If this Kickstarter funds, the three wheels will be set on top of each other as physical dials that actually spin. What’s the solution? You’ll have to buy the module to find out!
To add additional replay value, author Michael Curtis has also designed five additional game mechanisms that utilize the spinning wheel (more puzzles, magic items, etc.). These are included with the adventure module and can be used in your group's future adventures.
The normal color cover for The Chained Coffin (without the physical spinning wheel).
The Bonus Adventure
Included in the printed module is a short bonus adventure, The Rat King’s River of Death, written by Steven Bean. Steven was a finalist in our 2012 Mystery Map Adventure Design Competition. The Rat King’s River of Death is a stand-alone adventure that continues the escapades of the Rat King, as originally introduced in DCC #1: Idylls of the Rat King more than a decade ago.
The Signature Stickers
To commemorate this Kickstarter, the first 100 copies of The Chained Coffin that are pledged will include a signature plate. Illustrated by Doug Kovacs and signed by author Michael Curtis, the signature plate will be in the form of a "skater sticker" for you to stick wherever you want. Presumably on the book -- and we recommend the "open space" on the back cover -- but what the heck, it's a sticker and you can do whatever you want with it!

Stretch Goals
Update 6/1: Yet another stretch goal beaten!
First, the Chained Coffin will be a boxed set! All Kickstarter orders of silver foil or gold foil will include the box.
Second, we have now passed stretch goal #11! The gazetteer will be expanded even more! And there will now be a THIRD adventure included in the boxed set, in addition to the Almanac, the 0-level bonus module, the Chained Coffin, and the add-on spinning wheel!
Third, we have posted an update with a variety of new add-on items! Support the project with a T-shirt, flask, belt buckle, or beer cozy!
Finally, please note that the spinning wheel prop will be printed as a separate cardboard handout for the foil editions.
The great thing about Dungeon Crawl Classics adventure modules is that there are lots of potentially cool add-ons! Here are the stretch goals for this project. If things go well, we will end up with an even cooler adventure module than we started out with!
$6,000: FUNDED! We’ll add additional sourcebook material for the adventure module, to be written by Michael Curtis, including a patron writeup for Ol’ Blackcloak (read the module to find out who he is!), a mini-gazetteer on the Shudder Mountains regions, and more!
$7,000: FUNDED! We’ll add several pages of additional random encounters that can be used in various places throughout the adventure!
$8,000: FUNDED! We’ll add two full pages of player handouts, to be illustrated by the immortal Doug Kovacs!
$9,000: FUNDED! We’ll add stats and descriptions for 7 alternate versions of the Bad Lick Beast. That’s the awful monster you see on the front cover. Meet its relatives, hybrids, related species, and other incarnations!
$10,000: FUNDED! We’ll add two more pages of player handouts!
$12,000: FUNDED! We'll add another short bonus adventure -- which will be a zero level funnel set in the Shudder Mountains! This will include new zero-level professions and will let you start a campaign that leads to the Chained Coffin. 
$14,000: FUNDED! The additional material will be bundled into a separate stand-alone Almanac Of The Shudder Mountains. This will also include a new Bestiary of the Shudder Mountains. 
$18,000: FUNDED! The Almanac will be expanded to include Magic of the Shudder Mountains. 
$20,000: FUNDED! The Almanac will be upgraded to 24 pages of normal letter-sized pages, and will be expanded to include even more gazetteer material. 
$25,000: FUNDED! We'll add in another mini-adventure in the Shudder Mountains, that fills the gap between your level 0 characters and the level 5 Chained Coffin module. This will be included in all silver and gold foil boxed sets.
$30,000: FUNDED! The Almanac will be expanded with another 8 pages of gazetteer material further expanding the Shudder Mountain region.
$35,000: We'll print an 11"x17" poster map of the Shudder Mountains region.
The Physical Product
This Kickstarter funds the manufacturing cost of an adventure module including a series of three spinning wheels on the inside cover. The adventure is already written and playtested. Estimated length of the printed adventure is 28-32 pages.
The adventure module will be produced with two covers: a full-color cover, and a silver foil cover featuring an alternate illustration. Both covers are by Doug Kovacs, and are already complete. The cartography is by also by Doug, and is also complete.
The adventure module will be illustrated with B/W art, similar to other modules in the Dungeon Crawl Classics line of adventure modules.
Negotiating with Ol' Blackcloak: a fun encounter in the adventure.
Appendix N Inspiration
Dungeon Crawl Classics adventure modules utilize the rules of the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game (DCC RPG). DCC RPG is inspired by Appendix N, the bibliography of fantasy and science fiction literature which inspired D&D co-creator Gary Gygax. One of the most distinctive contributors to Appendix N is Manly Wade Wellman – a contributor who is often overlooked.
The Chained Coffin is inspired by the mountain-fantasy stories of Manly Wade Wellman. His Silver John stories were set in the dark, woodsy places of backwoods mountain country, where spirits and haunts were a real part of everyday life. As author Michael Curtis described his work on this adventure:
One of the great joys of writing DCC RPG adventures comes from the game’s commitment to remaining true to the classic pulp-era fantasy and science-fiction stories that inspired fantasy roleplaying, the so-called “Appendix N” tales. And while “sword & sorcery” yarns comprise the lion’s share of Appendix N, they are not the only types of stories found within it. The Chained Coffin derives its inspiration from American folklore, as perceived through the atmospheric works of Manly Wade Wellman. You’ll find no kobolds and orcs in The Chained Coffin, but plenty of restless ghosts, shunned witches and conjure-men, and devils willing to make a deal at midnight, all set against a backdrop of superstition-filled mountains and secluded hollows where the still air smells of pine trees. Heady stuff, indeed, and a far cry from your traditional fantasy RPG fare.
The Chained Coffin stands as my favorite DCC RPG adventure to date. The opportunity to create and then dwell for a time within a region more at home in the eons-old Appalachian Mountains than the fantastical landscapes of Tolkien, Howard, Moorcock, and Leiber was a designer’s dream. Hopefully, my personal enjoyment will be shared by you, the judge and player. So gather ‘round the fire, friends, pass the jug this way, and bend an ear to the music of the mountains. There are both horrors and wonders waiting in the Deep Hollows and, if you listen close at midnight, you might just hear a tune or two played on a lonesome fiddle strung with silver strings…
About The Author
Michael Curtis has been playing role-playing games for over thirty years, and has been a freelance writer and game designer since 2008. He has written or contributed to nearly forty roleplaying games, supplements, and articles. Best known for Goodman Games’ The Dungeon Alphabet (for which he was awarded the 2011 Three Castles Award for Game Design) and Stonehell Dungeon, he’s also worked on the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG, Goblinoid Games’ Realms of Crawling Chaos and MAJUS, and Chapter 13 Press’ Tales from the Fallen Empire. The author of ten DCC RPG adventures including Emirikol Was Framed!, The Sea Queen Escapes!, The Croaking Fane, Frozen in Time, and Intrigue at the Court of Chaos, Michael’s work has also appeared in the pages of Gygax Magazine and he is a regular contributor to Fight On! magazine. Michael’s upcoming projects for Goodman Games include The Chained Coffin, The Four Phantasmagorias adventure series, and The Adventurer’s Almanac. He lives in Suffolk County, NY, with the requisite number of cats for a writer and far too many books.
About Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
DCC RPG is an old-school tabletop role playing game that uses modern rules. Its inspiration is Appendix N, and its rules set is derived from the D20 system (which powered the third edition of D&D). DCC RPG is a single complete rulebook with no additional products to buy. It is supported by an extensive line of adventure modules, and a robust community of third party publishers. DCC RPG has been widely praised for its innovative approach to “old-school.” You can find more information at www.goodman-games.com/dccrpg.html

campaign.story:
The Lost City of Barakus Returns!
Frog God Games strikes again. More material from The Lost Lands is on the way, and while we finish up the massive Sword of Air, we decided to go ahead and get the next volume of material going.

Winner of the 2004 ENWorld Gold Ennie for Best Adventure, this hardcover book is the original (revised and expanded) work by WDBK Kenower and Bill Webb. The book will be produced in 2 versions, one for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and one for the Swords & Wizardry Roleplaying Game. 

For all you Lost Lands fans out there, this one is canon — it interfaces with Stoneheart Valley, Rappan Athuk, and Sword of Air, and represents the next of many ongoing chronicles of the Frog God Games/Necromancer Games home world. A MUST HAVE book for any fan of our material.

Our base level of funding is small — we wanted to keep the price point down on this. We listened to your feedback from our last few Kickstarters — and we are adding more new material based on stretch goals as detailed below. 

The Lost City of Barakus, designed to take characters from 1st to 5th or 6th level (or higher), is as much of a campaign setting as an adventure. Detailed within these pages is the great, bustling metropolis of Endhome, the Penprie Forest and Duskmoon Hills located north of that city, and, finally, the huge dungeon that is the Lost City of Barakus. Within all these areas are many adventures, NPCs, and locations for the party to explore, interact with and conquer. How and in what order the party chooses to take on the various challenges before them is entirely yours (the GM’s) and the players’ choice.
Though given specific location names, the adventure herein could easily be modified to fit in any campaign world. As always, change, add, modify, delete and alter as necessary to meet the needs and desires of you and your gaming group.

Adventure Background
Centuries ago, a race of humans built an elaborate underground city beneath the Duskmoon Hills called Barakus. These were a magic-loving people, and for hundreds of years they dwelled peacefully in their subterranean home, delving into the arcane arts. Eventually, however, one of their number, a necromancer named Devron, rose to great power and transformed himself into a lich. The wizards of Barakus banded together, and after a great struggle, banished him to a prison far below the city. Before his banishment, however, Devron forged the helm of power, which he could use to restore his power at some future point.

Though Devron was locked away in a magical prison, the wizards of Barakus knew that someday he might use his powerful magic to somehow free himself, and so they created a weapon, the sword of Kell, which a mighty warrior could use against him. Because they wanted control over who got and used the sword, it was forged such that unless empowered in a specific room in Barakus with the use of three orbs of power which were themselves powered by three “flames” — small geometric shapes scattered throughout the city. The idea was that the three elders of the city must agree on a champion before they offered their flame: without complete agreement, the sword was useless.
However, before a suitable champion could be found to battle Devron, the lich played a risky gambit. At great expense to personal power, he summoned a stone of madness, which erupted through the floor near the gates to his prison. This magical stone had the power to drive all sentient creatures mad. This it did, and the good people of Barakus soon destroyed themselves, and the city fell into ruin.
Centuries passed. The stone of madness’ power diminished and most of the city was freed from its effects. Eventually, creatures from the Under Realms and the surrounding wilderness began moving into the city and using its many halls and chambers for their lairs.

Barakus is now a massive dungeon, filled with creatures that have their own designs and desires. Many of the inhabitants over the years have altered the layout of the city slightly to fit their needs, and hundreds of years of monstrous habitation has left the city’s once-great halls filled with forgotten treasures and un-sprung traps.
Of course, Devron still dwells deep beneath the earth in his magical prison, and as is the wont with trapped liches, he would like nothing more than to escape his prison and find his helm of power, which would restore the power he lost during his captivity. While exploring the city, the party may decide to find the sword of Kell, empower it, and go after Devron. The battle between the heroes and the lich is likely to serve as a climax to this adventure.
Add-Ons
$15 The Lost City of Barakus Hero Lab Files - Hero Lab files allows customers to modify, print or use our NPCs in their home campaigns, fast and easy. It also allows them to export to online formats such as D20 Pro or other virtual tabletops.
Stretch Goals
All stretch goals for this Kickstarter will focus on additional content.
$20,000 Bonus Dungeon Level 4B (UNLOCKED) - "Hall of the Shield" (written by WDBK Kenower, Bill Webb.) This level will add a new and powerful shield that the players will find highly useful during the end game and battle against Devron. Further, after the players leave the environs of Barakus, both the shield and Sword of Kell could take them to the next stage of their adventure in the depths of Rappan Athuk or in their quest for the Sword of Air.
$22,500 New Wilderness Encounter (UNLOCKED) -  Bill will add an additional wilderness encounter of 2000-4000 words to the book. These encounters will include: mini-dungeons, monster lairs, new monsters, and new magical items never before seen in the Lost Lands. 
$25,000 New Wilderness Encounter (UNLOCKED) -  Bill will add an additional wilderness encounter of 2000-4000 words to the book. These encounters will include: mini-dungeons, monster lairs, new monsters, and new magical items never before seen in the Lost Lands.
$27,500 New Wilderness Encounter (UNLOCKED) -  Bill will add an additional wilderness encounter of 2000-4000 words to the book. These encounters will include: mini-dungeons, monster lairs, new monsters, and new magical items never before seen in the Lost Lands.
$30,000 Player's Guide (UNLOCKED) (Free PDF to all backers) Add $5 per player's guide for softcover (price goes up to $10 after the Kickstarter.)
$40,000 Black and White Double-Sided map of Endhome and the Local Wilderness Area (UNLOCKED) This Black and White map shows the locations within Endhome one one side, and on the reverse is the local Wilderness Area. (Add-On price $4 each for physical copy, $2 each for PDF copy)
$45,000 Discounted Add-On Books (UNLOCKED) When the project is over we will offer existing Frog God Games books as Add-Ons. Most of these books will be discounted 10-50% off!!!  
$50,000 Iconic PCs (UNLOCKED) Our existing Iconics will get an overhaul, and a few new ones will be joining the group. Use them as pre-gens, rival NPCs, or whatever you need them for!  
$55,000 Full Color Region Map (UNLOCKED) This full color map shows a wide expanse of The Lost Lands from the Sinnar Ocean to the southern reaches of the March of Mountains and includes key locations that we've been to or heard rumor of such as Rappan Athuk and the Forest of Hope. ABOUT CASTLES & CRUSADES
Castles & Crusades is a fantasy role playing game with countless possibilities. Designed for use with multiple players, Castles & Crusades puts you in charge of the adventure path. Spells, equipment, fast-paced combat rules, and all essential information needed to play a game of Castles & Crusades are in this book.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Moving a product line from black & white to color is a huge risk. The costs associated with the improvement are large. The interior pages need redesigned, the art converted from black and white to color, the whole of it needs to be integrated. Paper concerns in the actual printing play a role, as some papers absorb color better than others. The cost of printing the physical books is large as well, usually double what it costs to print in black & white.

To bring all three main C&C books out in color is a large leap for TLG and will take a pretty penny to do so. But with this Kickstarter we hope to fund the expansion and place C&C on the top shelf of retail shops across the country and to Europe, Australia and New Zealand.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Along the banks of a crescent bend in the lower Mississippi River lies a city like no other. It is an old city with a colorful, often tragic history, a place where different races, cultures, and religions meet, sometimes blending and other times clashing. It’s a city rich in the arts, where music and food are celebrations of life. Yet beneath it all, there is another city, a haunted place where mysterious cults worship in the surrounding swamps, sagging plantations hide terrifying secrets, and the sins of the past do not stay silent or unanswered. The dark and dangerous powers of the mythos are woven thickly into the tapestry of the Crescent City; they have always been and always will be.
Golden Goblin Press is proud to present Tales of the Crescent City—Adventures in Jazz Era New Orleans.
This collection of 1920s adventures for 6th Edition Call of Cthulhu features scenarios by Stuart Boon, Daniel Harms, C. Michael Hurst, Oscar Rios, and Kevin Ross.  
Scenario Descriptions
The Quickening Spiral, by Stuart Boon - Wherein the investigators struggle to find a cure to a deadly plague sweeping across the city. Soon, they find themselves suffering the very same symptoms. As they race against time, they will stumble upon obsession, magic, and an evil mankind was never meant to encounter. 
Needles, by Daniel Harms - Wild stories of mysterious figures kidnapping and performing medical experiments on their victims might be more fact than urban legend, as the investigators interrupt the shadowy figures known as the Needle Men in the middle of their latest abduction.
Bloodlines, by C. Michael Hurst - The investigators find themselves researching an ancient family, once prosperous, but now in decline. Their investigation leads them to a track of undeveloped swampland, a sinister developer, and a reclusive Indian tribe. The fetid swamps of Louisiana hide many things, like family secrets and deadly predators. 
Song and Dance, by Oscar Rios - Wherein the investigators are swept up in a calamitous event striking on New Year's Eve. Musicians, singers, dancers, choreographers, and composers all over New Orleans suddenly lose the ability to practice their art. Some simply fall dead while others go mad, some attempting to take their own lives. But the mysterious crisis is more dangerous than anyone knows and unless stopped, the world may never be the same.
and... saving the best for last... Twenty five years ago, Chaosium released The Great Old Ones, and within it was a scenario set in New Orleans. 
It was called "Tell Me, Have You Seen The Yellow Sign?", by Kevin Ross. In it the Most Honorable Krewe of the Swords was infiltrated by Papa Screech and the Cult of Hastur. This culminated in a summoning that allowed Carcosa to merge briefly with a haunted stretch of swamps outside of New Orleans. The investigators (hopefully) thwarted the cult, preventing it from granting the King In Yellow a human form to inhabit and restoring the barriers between our world and Carcosa, the realm of entropy.  
But then what happened?  Golden Goblin Press is deeply honored that Kevin Ross agreed to come out of retirement and tell us himself. It brings us great pleasure to offer you...
Asylum - Return of The Yellow Sign, by Kevin Ross - Several years after the terrifying events in the swamp and the defeat of the Cult of Hastur, a strange figure arrives in New Orleans.  Why has he come, and from where? What does he want?  Why does he spread madness and terror wherever he appears?  What is that strange inexplicable symbol he wears, and why does he don a pale mask?  Is it a mask? It seems that the second act has begun, and for some, it will be a final curtain call.
Art - We're pleased to have back with us Dean Engelhardt creating our player aids and Reuban Dodd as our cover and interior illustrator.  We're happy to welcome Steff Worthington as our cartographer.  For those of you who were lucky enough to get the bonus scenario from our last Kickstarter, "Owlglass", you may have noticed the layout style. That's the work of Mark Shireman, who'll be handling layout for this project.
Timetable - This book has not only been fully written; it's well into editing and is poised to enter layout. We are determined to bring our backers a finished PDF, if not a physical book, within four months after the Kickstarter closes.  
We have nine supporter levels for backers to choose from, each named after a New Orleans neighborhood. Some of these supporter levels have a limited availability, so be sure to act fast if something appeals to you. Also, please note there is a +$15 shipping and handling fee for international backers.
Visiting Tourist ($1 - $4) - Golden Goblin Press is eternally grateful for your support.
Milneberg ($5 - $14) - Your name will be listed on the book's Thank You page.
Uptown ($15) -  Digital PDF copy of Tales from the Crescent City - Adventures in Jazz Era New Orleans, and your name will be listed on the book's Thank You page.
Algiers ($35) -  Digital PDF and physical copy of Tales of the Crescent City - Adventures in Jazz Era New Orleans, and your name will be listed on the book's Thank You page.
Marigny ($50, only 200 available, ONE REMAINING!) - Digital PDF and physical copy of Tales of the Crescent City - Adventures in Jazz Era New Orleans, your name will be listed on the book's Thank You page, and a physical copy of Secrets of New Orleans.

NOMA stands for the New Orleans Museum of Art, the city’s oldest fine arts institute.
NOMA Curator Level ($75, only 100 available) – Digital PDF and physical copy of Tales of the Crescent City - Adventures in Jazz Era New Orleans, your name will be listed on the book's Thank You page, 6 high quality limited edition 8x10 art prints chosen from the project’s interior illustrations (one from each scenario, if stretch goal #8 is unlocked this will be increased to 7 art prints), an official Tales of the Crescent City - Adventures in Jazz Era New Orleans tote bag and notebook.
The dimensions for the bag are 14" x 12 1/2" x 4".
